intro: Satureja sphenophylla, commonly known as mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a strong, pungent aroma due to the presence of essential oils. Satureja sphenophylla is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in cooler, high-altitude environments.
